discourse_list.title: Robinhood fined $30 million by New York State for failing to comply with anti-money-laundering and cybersecurity regulations

content.content: More bad news for Robinhood. In addition to the federal government inquiring ( Robinhood Executive Attacks SEC’s Plans to Shake Up Stock-Trading Rules - WSJ) New York State has now fined Robinhood 30 million. The State said Robinhood’s cybersecurity program failed to address the company’s operational risks, and its policies weren’t in compliance with the State’s cybersecurity and virtual currency regulations In addition, the State says Robinhood’s Bank Secrecy Act and anti-money-laundering compliance program was not provided with enough resources, including staff, and neglected to transition in a timely manner from a manual transaction monitoring system that was appropriate for the company’s size, transaction volumes and customer profiles.    Fox Business    Crypto arm of Robinhood fined $30 million by New York State's financial... The crypto arm of Robinhood has been fined $30 million by New York state's financial regulator for allegedly violating anti-money-laundering, cybersecurity and consumer protection rules.      It is important to keep in mind that even state regulators are out there ramping up compliance efforts, in addition to what the federal government is doing.

Wow, amazing, robin hood seemed to me the most disruptive and “cool” way to access finance in the USA. Likewise that I feel sets a precedent for regulators, they are going after crypto I don’t know if that is what you are trying to convey with this news @MFeinberg

No fee trading was revolutionary but now that all other serious brokers are doing it, I dont see a reason to use Robinhood. The other brokers have better capabilities, research teams and customer support. I dont see how they can recover from the meme stocks debacle
RobinHood likely ignored or didnt consult compliance attorneys who would have told them what they needed to do to keep regulators happy.  its not rocket science

I am just trying to convey that based upon what is happening, regulators are coming at all levels. I have hoped for meaningful guidance and legislation as opposed to enforcement. That has not happened yet but I want to be positive and have faith.

Actually it seems they did have counsel.    WSJ    Robinhood’s Crypto Unit Fined $30 Million by New York’s Top Financial Regulator The New York State Department of Financial Services alleges that Robinhood violated anti-money-laundering and cybersecurity regulations      “We have made significant progress building industry-leading legal, compliance, and cybersecurity programs, and will continue to prioritize this work to best serve our customers,” Robinhood’s Associate General Counsel of Litigation and Regulatory Enforcement Cheryl Crumpton said in a statement Tuesday. “We remain proud to offer a more accessible, lower-cost platform to buy and sell crypto and are excited to continue to grow our business in a responsible manner with new products and services that our customers want.” Originally, they might have been without counsel but I don’t know. Seems this was part of a settlement decree and Robinhood has not complied with its terms. But they can spin it too as you can see from the statement.

Yikes, crackdown season starting early… appreciate the post. Already seeing rumors that FTX is looking to acquire RH. Think they took something like a 7+% stake around a month ago. BlockFi, Voyager, RH, plus all of Alameda’s movement… SBF’s been scooping the competition for pennies.    Fox Business    FTX eyes Robinhood acquisition: report Robinhood is an acquisition target, according to a report. A possible deal comes after FTX CEO Samuel Bankman-Fried took a 7.6% stake in Robinhood in May.      Having multiple exchanges, a market maker, and a trading arm in the same room is a bit less than ideal.

Oh yes it is heating up. There is really so much going on and it happens so fast its hard to keep up. One of the things I love about blockchain is there is no set time zone so things are always happening. Of course that can be problematic at times too

CNBC – 2 Aug 22    Robinhood cutting about 23% of jobs, releases second-quarter earnings Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev said Tuesday in a press release that the company will reduce its headcount by approximately 23%.      They are in trouble not only from regulators but also users are leaving the platform, understandably so. They are hoping crypto will save them, we will see if having Robinhood as a crypto ally will be positive or negative but I am optimistic they will turn it around.

I saw that too. This typically happens like this. So sad to see how it impacts people just trying to work hard and do right by their families (or just for themselves). Like coinbase started cutting newly hired staff at or around when the legal stuff started to come out.

Thank you for being aware of everything, we must realize that the regulators are gradually hunting down everything that is wrong in the cryptographic industry or everything that we have seen with bad eyes, we can see this in two ways   Regulations are necessary for mass adoption and adding CBDCs   They are removing everything that has to do with crypto to give income to CBDCs   Both viewpoints have the same conclusion, but path number one is quite different from path number two.

You are right. Under the auspice of protecting the public, which I do believe is the true intent (and deservedly so) many of the good things in the crypto space will suffer. We need to grow and be prepared.
